features: Random itch spots appear on foot
notes: Canvas-based game with simple tap/click mechanics
Draw stylized noir foot outline in cyan (#00ffff)
Itch spots appear as red (#ff0000) pulsing circles
Game over shows final score and restart button
Mobile-first: large touch targets, responsive canvas
No d-pad needed - direct tap interaction on canvas
Sound effects optional (scratch sound, ding for hits)
Leaderboard stores high score in localStorage
Noir aesthetic: cyan foot, red itches, dark background

userPrompt: can you make a foot scratching interactive visualization game?

issues.message: Game is missing .mobile-controls section with touch buttons. For arcade games, mobile controls are REQUIRED even if the game uses direct canvas interaction.
Canvas click handler found, but no touchstart event listener with preventDefault for mobile optimization. Should use both touchstart (with {passive: false}) and click as fallback.

warnings.message: Canvas should have responsive sizing in @media query (e.g., canvas { max-width: 95vw; height: auto; })
Game relies solely on canvas tapping without dedicated mobile control buttons. While functional, best practice for arcade games includes visible touch controls for accessibility.
Code appears truncated (ends with '... [truncated]'). Cannot verify complete implementation of game loop, scoring, win/loss states, or full event handlers.
Canvas should have responsive sizing in @media query (e.g., canvas { max-width: 95vw; height: auto; })
Mobile controls present but only contain START/PAUSE buttons, not tap-to-scratch instructions. For this game type, the canvas itself is the primary control surface.
Canvas uses 'click' event listener. Should also include 'touchstart' with preventDefault for better mobile responsiveness.

docs.releaseNotes: yeah built you a foot scratch simulator with mobile d-pad controls and progressive itch spawning - works smooth on phones, tap those random itch spots before time runs out. got that satisfying particle feedback and classic noir terminal aesthetic.
docs.howToPlay: Tap or click the itchy spots that appear on the foot before they disappear. Each successful scratch earns points. Miss too many and it's game over. Itches spawn faster as you progress - stay sharp.
